snippet: Led by the Center for Science in the Public Interest, the group says the scientific consensus is that the level of added sugars in soft drinks is unsafe.
abstract: Group of health advocates and public health officials ask Food and Drug Administration to regulate amount of caloric sweeteners in sodas and other beverages, arguing scientific consensus is that level of added sugars in those products is unsafe.
lead_paragraph: Led by the Center for Science in the Public Interest, the group says the scientific consensus is that the level of added sugars in soft drinks is unsafe.

headline.seo: Health Officials Urge F.D.A. Action on Soft Drinks
headline.main: Health Officials Urge F.D.A. to Limit Sweeteners in Sodas
headline.print_headline: Health Officials Urge F.D.A. to Limit Sweeteners in Sodas
